org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a.commit.staging

Class StagingCommitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.OutputCommitter
      • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.output.PathOutputCommitter
        • org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a.commit.AbstractS3ACommitter
          • org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a.commit.staging.StagingCommitter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectoryStagingCommitter, PartitionedStagingCommitter

    public class StagingCommitter
extends AbstractS3ACommitter
    Committer based on the contributed work of the Netflix multipart committers.
    1. The working directory of each task is actually under a temporary path in the local filesystem; jobs write directly into it.
    2. Task Commit: list all files under the task working dir, upload each of them but do not commit the final operation. Persist the information for each pending commit into the cluster for enumeration and commit by the job committer.
    3. Task Abort: recursive delete of task working dir.
    4. Job Commit: list all pending PUTs to commit; commit them.
    5. Job Abort: list all pending PUTs to commit; abort them. Delete all task attempt directories.
    This is the base class of the Partitioned and Directory committers. It does not do any conflict resolution, and is made non-abstract primarily for test purposes. It is not expected to be used in production.

      • getUploadUUID

        public static String getUploadUUID(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                   String jobId)
        Get the UUID of an upload; may be the job ID. Spark will use a fake app ID based on the current minute and job ID 0. To avoid collisions, the key policy is:
        1. Value of InternalCommitterConstants.FS_S3A_COMMITTER_STAGING_UUID.
        2. Value of "spark.sql.sources.writeJobUUID".
        3. Value of "spark.app.id".
        4. JobId passed in.
        The staging UUID is set in in setupJob(JobContext) and so will be valid in all sequences where the job has been set up for the configuration passed in.
        Parameters:
        conf - job/task configuration
        jobId - Job ID
        Returns:
        an ID for use in paths.

      • getTaskOutput

        protected List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.LocatedFileStatus> getTaskOutput(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.TaskAttemptContext context)
                                                              throws IOException
        Lists the output of a task under the task attempt path. Subclasses can override this method to change how output files are identified.

        This implementation lists the files that are direct children of the output path and filters hidden files (file names starting with '.' or '_').

        The task attempt path is provided by AbstractS3ACommitter.getTaskAttemptPath(TaskAttemptContext)

        Parameters:
        context - this task's TaskAttemptContext
        Returns:
        the output files produced by this task in the task attempt path
        Throws:
        IOException - on a failure

      • getFinalKey

        protected String getFinalKey(String relative,
                             org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
        Returns the final S3 key for a relative path. Subclasses can override this method to upload files to a different S3 location.

        This implementation concatenates the relative path with the key prefix from the output path. If CommitConstants.FS_S3A_COMMITTER_STAGING_UNIQUE_FILENAMES is set, then the task UUID is also included in the calculation

        Parameters:
        relative - the path of a file relative to the task attempt path
        context - the JobContext or TaskAttemptContext for this job
        Returns:
        the S3 key where the file will be uploaded

      • getFinalPath

        protected final org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getFinalPath(String relative,
                                                       org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
                                                throws IOException
        Returns the final S3 location for a relative path as a Hadoop Path. This is a final method that calls getFinalKey(String, JobContext) to determine the final location.
        Parameters:
        relative - the path of a file relative to the task attempt path
        context - the JobContext or TaskAttemptContext for this job
        Returns:
        the S3 Path where the file will be uploaded
        Throws:
        IOException - IO problem

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of pending uploads. If an exception was swallowed, then this may not match the actual set of pending operations
        Throws:

      • abortJobInternal

        protected void abortJobInternal(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context,
                                boolean suppressExceptions)
                         throws IOException
        Description copied from class: AbstractS3ACommitter
        The internal job abort operation; can be overridden in tests. This must clean up operations; it is called when a commit fails, as well as in an AbstractS3ACommitter.abortJob(JobContext, JobStatus.State) call. The base implementation calls AbstractS3ACommitter.cleanup(JobContext, boolean)
        Overrides:
        abortJobInternal in class AbstractS3ACommitter
        Parameters:
        context - job context
        suppressExceptions - should exceptions be suppressed?
        Throws:
        IOException - any IO problem raised when suppressExceptions is false.

      • deleteDestinationPaths

        protected void deleteDestinationPaths(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobContext context)
                               throws IOException
        Delete the working paths of a job. Does not attempt to clean up the work of the wrapped committer.
        1. The job attempt path
        2. $dest/__temporary
        3. the local working directory for staged files
        Parameters:
        context - job context
        Throws:
        IOException - IO failure

      • commitTaskInternal

        protected int commitTaskInternal(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.TaskAttemptContext context,
                                 List<? extends org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileStatus> taskOutput)
                          throws IOException
        Commit the task by uploading all created files and then writing a pending entry for them.
        Parameters:
        context - task context
        taskOutput - list of files from the output
        Returns:
        number of uploads committed.
        Throws:
        IOException - IO Failures.

      • abortTask

        public void abortTask(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.TaskAttemptContext context)
               throws IOException
        Abort the task. The API specifies that the task has not yet been committed, so there are no uploads that need to be cancelled. Accordingly just delete files on the local FS, and call abortTask in the wrapped committer. Important: this may be called in the AM after a container failure. When that occurs and the failed container was on a different host in the cluster, the local files will not be deleted.
        Specified by:
        abortTask in class org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.OutputCommitter
        Parameters:
        context - task context
        Throws:
        IOException - any failure

      • deleteTaskWorkingPathQuietly
